page.title:
Public Safety Radio Strategic Planning Committee
Public Safety Radio Strategic
Planning Committee

Public Safety Radio Strategic Planning Committee (PSRSPC)
Public Safety Radio
Strategic Planning
Committee (PSRSPC)
page.normal_text:
In 2002, the California Legislature enacted the California Public Safety Communications Act of 2002*. This act established the PSRSPC which gives primary responsibility to state government for the following:
In 2002, the California Legislature enacted the California Public Safety
Communications Act of 2002*. This act established the PSRSPC which
gives primary responsibility to state government for the following:

Development and implementation of a statewide integrated public safety communications system to facilitate interoperability among state public safety agencies, as well as other first responder agencies.
Development and implementation of a statewide integrated public
safety communications system to facilitate interoperability among
state public safety agencies, as well as other first responder
agencies.

Coordination of other shared uses of public safety radio frequency spectrum.
Coordination of other shared uses of public safety radio frequency
spectrum.

page.title:
PSRSPC Membership
PSRSPC Membership
page.normal_text:
Established by statute to address the need for an integrated public safety communications system that facilitates interoperability among the state’s public safety departments (with existing communication systems), in collaboration with other federal, state, and local entities.
Established by statute to address the need for an integrated public safety communications system that
facilitates interoperability among the state’s public safety departments (with existing communication
systems), in collaboration with other federal, state, and local entities.

page.title:
PSRSPC Vision
PSRSPC Vision
page.normal_text:
Development, implementation, and administration of an innovative, inclusive, scalable, and sustainable statewide interoperable communications plan.
Development, implementation, and administration
of an innovative, inclusive, scalable, and
sustainable statewide interoperable
communications plan.
page.enlisting:
Facilitate modernization of wireless communication systems and interoperability. Provide effective, seamless, and reliable public safety services throughout California. Facilitate modernization of wireless communication systems and interoperability.
Facilitate modernization of wireless
communication systems and interoperability.
Provide effective, seamless, and reliable public safety services throughout California.
Provide effective, seamless, and reliable public
safety services throughout California.

page.title:
PSRSPC Mission
PSRSPC Mission
page.normal_text:
Provide the leadership to allow California to effectively leverage existing investments in communications infrastructures.
Provide the leadership to allow California to
effectively leverage existing investments in
communications infrastructures.

Respond rapidly and decisively to meet targeted goals for improved interoperability.
Respond rapidly and decisively to meet targeted
goals for improved interoperability.

Facilitate universal statewide access, enhance system modernization, increase functionality, and ensure adequate channel availability throughout California in support of public safety.
Facilitate universal statewide access, enhance
system modernization, increase functionality, and
ensure adequate channel availability throughout
California in support of public safety.

page.title:
PSRSPC Collaboration Guidelines
PSRSPC Collaboration
Guidelines
page.normal_text:
Partnerships allow for a stronger voice than one department or agency alone; all member agencies and departments have an equal voice.
Partnerships allow for a stronger voice than one
department or agency alone; all member agencies
and departments have an equal voice.

Respecting departmental perspectives is paramount to effective collaboration; all issues raised by members provide valuable information.
Respecting departmental perspectives is
paramount to effective collaboration; all issues
raised by members provide valuable information.

Fostering partnerships between state agencies is fundamental to achieve strategic goals; decision- making is conducted based on a majority vote process.
Fostering partnerships between state agencies is
fundamental to achieve strategic goals; decision-
making is conducted based on a majority vote
process.

page.title:
Technical Working Group
Technical Working Group
page.normal_text:
At the direction of the PSRSPC Executive Committee, the Technical Working Group (TWG) is comprised of PSRSPC member agency personnel and functions as the primary focal point for ongoing technical research and special studies.
At the direction of the PSRSPC Executive
Committee, the Technical Working Group (TWG) is
comprised of PSRSPC member agency personnel
and functions as the primary focal point for
ongoing technical research and special studies.

page.title:
Coordination with California Statewide Interoperability Executive Committee (CalSIEC)
Coordination with California
Statewide Interoperability
Executive Committee
(CalSIEC)
page.normal_text:
The California Statewide Interoperability Executive Committee (CalSIEC) is tasked with managing the state and federally designated interoperability spectrum on behalf of all local public safety first responders. The PSRSPC is required to hold a joint meeting with CalSIEC to enhance coordination and cooperation at every organizational level, as well as, develop a cohesive approach to communications interoperability.
The California Statewide Interoperability Executive
Committee (CalSIEC) is tasked with managing the state
and federally designated interoperability spectrum on
behalf of all local public safety first responders. The
PSRSPC is required to hold a joint meeting with CalSIEC
to enhance coordination and cooperation at every
organizational level, as well as, develop a cohesive
approach to communications interoperability.

page.title:
Road Map to 2017
Road Map to 2017
page.normal_text:
The fundamental plan for PSRSPC members consists of three basic components:
The fundamental plan for PSRSPC members consists of
three basic components:

Develop 10 year Interoperability Strategic Plan; including critical operability, tactical interoperability, as well as governance procedures and policies.
Develop 10 year Interoperability Strategic Plan; including
critical operability, tactical interoperability, as well as
governance procedures and policies.

Design and secure long term, sustainable funding mechanisms.
Design and secure long term, sustainable funding
mechanisms.

Build-out California’s System of Systems (SoS) including governance agreements and protocols.
